laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated troponin T level of 0.04 ng/mL
40% proximal focal stenosis in right coronary artery unchanged from 1 year previously; patent prior stent in LCx with 3 serial 90% stenoses; overall appearance suggestive of 'beads on a string'
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Proximal LCx stenoses were unchanged on repeat angiography after high-dose immunosuppressive therapy.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Multiple homogeneous concentric stenoses in proximal LCx with hyperreflective, thickened intima and isolated areas of hypoattenuation, suggesting a fibroproliferative and primary inflammatory process.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: OCT on repeat angiography revealed no evidence of dissection, thrombosis, or atherosclerosis within the segments, confirming prior findings.
Positive results consistent with previous tests.
